result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A Sumlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 + costs = $579.00. The Court grants the Defendant a payment plan at a rate of $50.00 a month, starting on or around 07/01/2022, and on the first of every month thereafter. Non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence.

The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for expungement in this file for reasons stated on the record.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin A Sumlin

records.addlTxt: PP Due Date Summary mailed to Defendant - Not Deliverable as Addressed/Unable to Fwd.

Order Firearms Destroy

ec/pc: DA, Atty Cotton, JCJ(6/2/22--ma)

[ml] Case called at 10:06AM
Defendant Justin A Sumlin in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheduled for a Status Conference, however the Defense advises that it it prepared to proceed with Plea and Sentencing today.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered as to Count #2 ; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #1.

As to Count #2: 
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 + costs = $579.00. The Court grants the Defendant a payment plan at a rate of $50.00 a month, starting on or around 07/01/2022, and on the first of every month thereafter. Non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence.

Days credit for time already served: 1 day

The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
The Court orders the destruction of the firearm used in the criminal incident.
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for expungement in this file for reasons stated on the record.

recess 10:24AM

Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

--not to possess any firearms
-- no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 08:39 AM Defendant Justin A Sumlin in court with attorney John M Binder. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--not to possess any firearms
-- no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 8:45 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/13/22 at 10;00 am  (2) Status Conference on 6/2/22 at 10:00 am
